H0.text: The rotation of Earth on its axis explains the relationship between hours of sunlight and seasons.

H1.text: The tilt of Earth's axis relative to the sun explains the relationship between hours of sunlight and seasons.

H2.text: The location of Earth's orbit in the solar system explains the relationship between hours of sunlight and seasons.

H3.text: The motion of the moon as it travels around Earth explains the relationship between hours of sunlight and seasons.

A4.text: The seasons are the result of the axial parallelism of Earth's tilted orbit around the Sun.

A5.text: The seasons are not the result of the variation in Earth's distance to the Sun because of its elliptical orbit.
